column4: I am trying to compile my own dapper kernel, but running into difficulties.
I have installed the sources package as well as the kernel-package
but when I do make menuconfig, I get a huge load of errors
I want the kernel compiled specifically for my transmeta cruseo
Another question is there a way to highlight responses to my nick in ircii?
The reason for my desire to have a crusoe kernel is, that I am experiencing system chrashes and I want to eliminate any possible reason.
But actually I think X is the problem.
How can I find out, what killed my system?
check /var/log/messages.3.gz
check /var/log/messages
I know that this is an acpi function! I mentioned the damn acpi for this damn laptop is broken earlier!
certainly not supported
feisty is alpha, nuf said
did you enable ENABLE_LAPTOP_MODE=true in /etc/default/acpi-support ?
what should that help?! This is some power saving stuff. Has nothing to do with a laptop shutting down the os but not powering off the damn hardware.
that's an acpi function
what is an acpi function?
turning off the power at shutdown
lots of people in support channels claim stuff is broken, doesn't mean it is
my info is accurate
and as I mentioned before, it is fixed in feisty
so how do I get the feisty kernel to run in edgy?
